elements.title: Answer the following questions in your own simple words.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: What is a brand?
elements.correctAnswer:
A legally protected sign (e.g. logo, lettering, slogan) with which a company can offer its goods and services and distinguish itself from other companies.
Examples: ABB, SBB logo, "Redbull gives wings", Ricola melody (all information from www.ige.ch)

elements.name: question2
elements.title: How long does trademark protection last?
elements.correctAnswer: At least ten years, can be extended as often as required for a further ten years.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What cannot be protected as a trademark? Why?
elements.correctAnswer: Individual characters (incl. numbers), abbreviations, coats of arms (e.g. Swiss coat of arms, name "Switzerland", the latter only with an addition, e.g. "Tropenhaus Schweiz", since 30.12.2009 or "Standort Schweiz", since 17.02.2000).

elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the following questions in your own simple words.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Why do you want to protect a trademark (benefit)?
elements.correctAnswer: Registering a trademark protects a product or service as intellectual property, including against free riders.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: How do you recognize that a trademark is protected?
elements.correctAnswer: The special character Â® ("registered", added to the name, but not mandatory in Switzerland, often for medicines) or TM, mainly in the Anglo-American world ("trademark", not protected by trademark law, but used like a trademark).

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Where can you find out whether a trademark (e.g. Swisscom) is protected? Is it, and if so, since when?
elements.correctAnswer:
On the website www.swissreg.ch.
Swisscom has been protected as a logo and lettering since 22.05.2008.
